snippet: Mark Emmert, the president of the N.C.A.A., is an unapologetic target of detractors as his organization faces legal challenges to its amateurism model.
abstract: Dr Mark A Emmert, president of the NCAA, has become an unapologetic target of criticism as his organization faces host of legal challenges and accusations that it exploits young athletes; Emmert deeply opposes unionization push and other efforts to undermine the amateurism model that has long governed college sports.

byline.original: By BEN STRAUSS and STEVE EDER

lead_paragraph: Mark Emmert, the president of the N.C.A.A., is an unapologetic target of detractors as his organization faces legal challenges to its amateurism model.

headline.main: Face of the N.C.A.A., Battered Early and Often
headline.print_headline: Face of the N.C.A.A., Battered Early and Often
